Review Title: Great place to stay, warm and wonderful staff, convenient location and awesome hospitality!
Negative Reviews: I couldn't think of anything except that we don't have a bathtub in the bathroom ;) We'll try to check a room with that in this hotel next time, if any.
Positive Reviews: The variety of breakfast menus is really good, and the restaurant staff is excellent and attentive to their guests. The room is always tidy and comfortable, and although there was a minor concern, it was attended to and resolved immediately. The Location is incredible‚Äîit's easy to get a cab, and close to the Egyptian Museum and shops. I love the hospitality especially of the Guest Relation Officer (Mariam, I hope I named her right) and Amir the Manager, both are excellent and very competent in handling the guest's needs and concerns as well as checking always if we are okay or have any issues. We feel so secure and safe all throughout our stay. Generally, every staff (reception, housekeeping, restaurant, pool area, and management) is truly commendable. Thanks a lot to all of them especially to Mariam and Amir! This hotel will always be our choice when having a vacation in Cairo.

Negative Reviews:

Positive Reviews:
The location is perfect.

My wife and I stayed in the Steigenberger Hotel Tahir in Cairo for a total of 4 nights on 3 different occasions during a 17-day holiday in Egypt.
The hotel is centrally located opposite the Egyptian Museum, although getting to the museum involves crossing several lanes of traffic with no pedestrian crossing!  There are also a large number of shops nearby. 
All the staff were very friendly and very helpful, especially Farida, Riham and Rabie.  
Our rooms were clean and comfortable and everything worked as it should. 
The breakfast buffet was very impressive and the dinners were good with plenty of choice.
Overall, an excellent hotel.
Very clean, Good location and the hotel staffs go above and beyond. Good breakfast choices and good location to city center. Would definitely be staying there again.

We were also very lucky to have a room upgrade, which was really appreciated. 
The hotel rooms are lovely, and the whole hotel complex is great. Great location as well. Close to downtown shops and the Nile as well as museums. 
Food and beverages were awesome, and it was good to have a broad selection of beverages.
We have no complaints and would definitely stay here again.

Positive Reviews: The hotel is very good and the location is excellent. Very close to everything as shops, malls, restaurants and historical attractions. Staff is very friendly and helpful. A little bit busy but it is ok. The hotel has a special person/desk for transportation and the payment is done through hotel reception. Excellent breakfast, with special bars for orders. Many types of food, fruits, bread, sweets etc. I believe it will be impossible to not satisfy majority of tastes. Rooms are small but enough to move inside. Special place for luggage, closes with hangers, slippers etc. Bathroom is nice and all toiletries you need. Daily cleaning a replenishment of bar. No balconies and not open windows. It is normally for hot places (same Dubai). Centralized AC and not noisy. Dinner in the restaurant is very good. Not a lot of choices but what they provide is very delicious. Restaurant staff is good and the dish is served really fast. It is a 4* hotel so do not expect low prices. Also the quality of services is 4*. Alcohol is served in the restaurant and bar. There are enough choices. They have live music in the lobby bar (very nice and good singer) and on the outside terrace bar. When we stay there was Egyptian Music. It is very nice to listen and to dive into their music. The terrace bar is not bad but definitely poorer than the inside bar. The hotel is out of main boulevard so, the noise from street is not very loud but there is. I remarked the cleaning personnel who is very polite/ professional and the doorman who is a big man but excellent behavior, very polite and supportive. Also reception staff was great. They try to solve the check-in/out very fast and other problems. We book a taxi via hotel which was nice and safe. I think they have their own taxis. Excellent services and drivers. We booked it 2 ways, I mean from hotel to Cairo Tower and back. The driver came to pick us up in time.

Review Title: Excelent value for money Hotel in downtown Cairo
Negative Reviews: Minor maintenance issues in the shower room, but nothing really significant .
Positive Reviews: Great location, good and safe atmosphere in the hotel. Very nice attitude of the staff. clean rooms and lovely swimming pool. The breakfast was diverse and tasty. Spa treatment was also a good experience in reasonable price.

Negative Reviews: Watch out for window cleaners if your curtains are open!
Positive Reviews: The location is perfect for exploring everything around downtown Cairo. Wide variety of food for breakfast and at the hotel restaurant (including local and international food). Room was spacious and well-equipped. Staff are extremely helpful, and customer service does a great job of following up from the check-in to check-out.

Review Title: Clean well located hotel in El Tahrir
Negative Reviews: El-Tahrir Square is very busy, traffic from noon to very late night. Egyptian drivers drive with car horn beeping all the time. We had rooms facing Nile, even to late night, it is quite noisy to sleep.
Positive Reviews: The hotel is located right in the El-Tahrir Square, some rooms has a Nile view and the National museum. All the Hotel staff are very nice and friendly, a contrast from outside the hotel. Rooms are clean, best of our Egyptian trip of similar price level. All the non-alcohol drinks in mini bar are complimentary. WiFi works well. First floor has a quiet working area, outside the ballrooms, which was useful for us to make zoom meetings.

Review Title: Was short and sweet - great value for money.
Negative Reviews: There was nothing major but if I had to pick one thing it was that The bed sheets had some bobbling on which wasn‚Äôt very pleasant to the skin.
Positive Reviews: Location and how clean the hotel was. The staff was also very nice. The room service food was fabulous and the spa/massage was amazing.

Negative Reviews:
Very noisy area. Even though we were at the 10th floor honking goes on the whole night, during the weekend there was loud music coming from the square till 1 am at least.
The solution would be thicker windows.
While taking a shower the water overflows to the bathroom floor.
Positive Reviews:
Super good breakfast with a lot of choices and best quality.
Very well trained staff. A plus point goes to the bellboy, friendly and energetic, he promptly helped us to solve a problem we had at the beginning.
Location is central on Tahrir Square, good starting point to visit the Egyptian museum, the Islamic Cairo and Coptic Cairo. Clean, good bed, good wifi.

Review Title: Excellent food and service. Comfort just let down slightly by roll together bed.
Negative Reviews: Bed had a sag to the centre so roll together was annoying.
Positive Reviews: In central Cairo. Excellent food and service. Had a great massage in spa. Spacious clean room.

Review Title: Great service, facilities and value for money.
Negative Reviews: Bed sheets, pillow cases were over used, had marks. However, as soon as we asked, the staff quickly changed them for us. So no issues as such.
Positive Reviews: Great location, high security place. Wide range of breakfast options with great quality. Overall good hotel rooms and amenity. Very helpful staff.

Positive Reviews:
It‚Äôs has everything that you need ! 
Great location ! 
Great staff , from the restaurant service to room service!

Negative Reviews: Even up on the 9th floor, you could still hear the noise from street level (car horns, motorbike exhaust, voices).
Positive Reviews: The front desk/reception staff are the best I‚Äôve seen at any hotel I‚Äôve stayed at. Very willing to help, to answer questions, make reservations, provide suggestions etc. They were always warm and hospitable with a big smile to greet you. Complimentary water bottles, fruit and sweets left in the room each day. The breakfast buffet had a excellent variety of food and beverages to choose from. The location was excellent- central and convenient. Across from the Egyptian Museum, 10-15 mins to Zamalek and Cairo Tower.

Negative Reviews:

Review Title: Great hotel in a very convenient location in Cairo
Negative Reviews: We liked everything, unfortunately we could not use the swimming pool when we arrived because there was an event and there was a problem with the cards and the lifts, but they sorted it out.
Positive Reviews: Everything; the staff were kind and helpful, the location is great, it is very comfortable and clean, and the breakfast has a lot of choices for every taste, everything we tried was really good.

Negative Reviews: Unfortunately the swimming pool was packed. Not the hotel‚Äôs fault, just too many guests wanting to enjoy a swim I guess
Positive Reviews: Location, closed to Cairo museum, zamalek and other sites. The staff are great and friendly. Great welcome. Good breakfast and excellent room service. Great security, the hotel feels really safe.

Review Title: A lovely oasis after being out most of the day.
Negative Reviews:
The hotel is in the middle of the hustle and bustle. The first night I was a little taken aback by how loud it still is, bit after a while the noise subsided. 

There was no safety latch on the door; however, they assured me that the double lock feature is secure.
Positive Reviews:
The hotel is quite close to most of the attractions, short drive to the Pyramids of Giza, Saqqara + Memphis. it was also in close proximity to the Al Khalili Bazar and Coptic Cairo. 

The breakfast had different variations of the food on the daily and I was often delightfully surprised by the options.

The staff was extremely pleasant and always really helpful. The hotel was immaculately clean. 

The hotel was also in walking distance to a number of great restaurants, coffee shops and the Egyptian Museum.

Negative Reviews: The noise! But this is expected as the hotel is situated downtown! the rooftop pool was great, though noise was off-putting but after a while it seemed to drown out!
Positive Reviews: breakfast was decent although there could have been more variety. staff at hotel were very helpful.  We ordered room service two nights, delivered with brilliant service and food was great. overall decent hotel in great location.

Negative Reviews: Only thing is the noise outside early in morning but Cairo is busy city so everywhere in downtown will be noisy
Positive Reviews:
Wow amazing service from this Hotel.
From the Porter to the top management.
A special mention goes to Farida and Marina as well as the manager Mr Ahmed.

I dont think i have received such hospitality anywhere in the world , really great service from the team.

The Hotel is very clean, beds were comfortable with amazing breakfast. 
Location is excellent as its close to the main museum and also the city. 

Cairo is a busy city, but this hotel is a hidden gem and is definitely good value for money and a top Hotel if you looking for a good stay.

Well done Team Steigenburger üëè

Negative Reviews: Lobby needs small tables and chairs not the large sofas. In the days of COVID that does not work.
Positive Reviews:
Ready even for our late arrival. Check in fast. Room clean and ready. Hotel safe and security is wonderful. Staff aware of guests. Walking distance to almost all major areas. Uber easy access. Taxis easy access. Felfela restaurant nearby a great meal and tradition in Cairo. Soon Nile promenade will be open and will be a ten minute walk. Views of Nile and Tahrir square at night very nice. Area clean and well protected. Nearby fast food chains easy walking. Small convenience stores all around. 
Best feature is the reasonable prices. Other hotels in the area are ridiculously inflated prices for the name but definitely overvalued. Even some of the other big names around rooms are outdated and neglected for excessive prices. 
Steigenberger keep your prices reasonable. 
Made a week of work much less exhausting.

Review Title: Great city hotel with lovely staff
Negative Reviews: Nothing, great hotel for a city stay
Positive Reviews: Good location next to The Egyptian Museum in Cairo. Staff were really friendly and helpful on arrival and throughout our stay. Great breakfast, lots to choose from. The room was spacious, really comfy bed and the shower was amazing, had hot water immediately. We ate in the restaurant downstairs, same area as breakfast, and really enjoyed our meals. It has a nice little bar in the reception area serving alcohol, so after a day out in Cairo and after a hot shower it was good to have a drink there. The barman was really friendly. The pool was small and noisy from the traffic but you would expect it in a city hotel so don't let that put you off, it was a nice area to sit as the sun went down.

Review Title: Great value for money, fantastic staff and good location.

Negative Reviews: There is absolutely nothing bad I can say about this Hotel

There is nothing bad I can say about this Hotel. When we did the checking they upgraded to a presidential suite....so the whole experience was magical. I Can't have enough gratitude for that.

Hotel is in great location, nice bar near the Hotel if you decide leave the Hotel.

Positive Reviews: An excellent hotel which delivers on everything. cleanliness, staff, food, facilities, location.

Review Title: I found the much needed comfort, cleanliness and warm-welcoming attitude in this hotel during a tiring long Cairo visit.
Negative Reviews: There was nothing that I didnt like about the property.
Positive Reviews:
This hotel is in an amazingly central location, one minute walk to the Museum of Egyptian Antiquities, and to the Tahrir Square, couple of more minutes to the shores of the Nile. 

Rooms are very spacious, extremely clean and comfortable. Breakfast buffet is another level. It has to be tried even if one does not stay here. 

I was coming from the Giza and I did not have a good stay there, arrived this hotel very early in the morning, way before the check-in time. But the reception personnel were amazingly kind and understanding. I especially must mention Muhammad Emin who did not only arrange me a room to check-in early but also upgraded my room too. His huge smile and friendly attitude made my stay a memorable one. Also, the Guest Relations Supervisor Farida Amr could be kindest person that I have met in Egypt. She always smiles to solve problems, and even speaks in your language to make you feel at home. 

These people made the hotel a must stay location for me for all my future visits to Cairo.

The property is clean, confortable and the staff provides an excellent  and genuine customer service. Before our arrival Riham Khaled  kindly helped us to organize a tour of Cairo, Citadel, Coptic Neighborhood and the Museum as well as airport transfers. She patiently answered all our questions and when we arrived the airport transfers and the tour were ready and everything went smoothly. The tour guide Alba and the driver were fantastic very knowledgeable and we learned so much with her. Her Spanish was impeccable. We booked the hotel with breakfast included. When the receptionist learned we had plan a tour to Luxor early morning they offered a breakfast box which included Turkey sandwich, water, croissants, fruits and yogurt. It was tasty and it was a life saver !  The restaurant is open 24 hours which was very convenient specially when we returned very late from a tour. They have an international menu and some local dishes , food is tasty and no complaints. Don‚Äôt forget to try the Om Ali is delicious! We had breakfast and dinner and every time the staff at the restaurant was genuinely attentive and provided an excellent customer service always with a smile. They are  young and eager to help thank you Yoanna for being so nice and helpful, Ghandour and Saleh were always friendly, polite and genuine.  It was a pleasure staying at Steigenberger El Tahrir!

Review Title: Impeccable facility and service, great location, highly recommended
Negative Reviews: For traveling in the city, I would recommend calling an Uber. Concierge will direct you to booking a car with them but the price is exorbitant relative to what it costs with an Uber or taxi. Concierge did not provide help in hailing a taxi.
Positive Reviews: We traveled as a family of four including two children, aged 2 and 6. The location couldn't be better, as it was at the heart of the city and able to reach the Egyptian museum within a very short walking distance with a stroller! The facility was impeccable, as was the service of the staff. Any request was addressed immediately and professionally. The rooms were very clean with all the necessary amenities. The outdoor pool was satisfactory. Breakfast was beyond expectations and roomservice food was also tasty. We stayed three nights, and we were so happy with our stay that we expect to look for its branches elsewhere around the world in our next travels. Thank you so much!
Large comfortable room, very helpful staff, great location near Tahrir Square and the Egyptian museum. On site restaurant, bar and evening entertainment was a nice plus.

Negative Reviews: Nothing
Positive Reviews: Our room was absolutely stunning with a panoramic view of Tahrir Square. Facilities, room, service, pool and breakfast all amazing. Special thanks to duty manager Hamza for wonderful and personal service. We will return.

Negative Reviews: Nothing.
Positive Reviews: Everything spells perfection here.  The location, which is right across the museum and within the downtown market. The rooms are spotlessly clean, well lit and big. The bed is very comfortable. The shower is strong and gets  hot water. The staff is ever helpful, always willing to got the extra mile to make the guest comfortable. The food is sumptuous. The breakfast buffet is excellent with wide variety of food on offer. The pool and pool bar are a great way to de stress after a long day of sightseeing in the sun. In room dining menu is great offering wide variety of delicious food. A 24 hour menu is available as well.  This is a great base in Cairo. Would highly recommend everyone to stay here. I'm looking forward to my return here. Kudos to the entire team and staff for such perfection

The staff was outstanding. Polite, hospitable and professional at the same time. 
The room was clean, tidy and cozy - the daily cleaning service was thorough. 
The food was amazing as well. Huge variety and high quality with amazing tastes. 
It's a well-guarded facility with K9 and officers armed with guns, so maximum security is provided. 
The location is perfect and the swimming pool is exceptionally clean and well-maintained.

Review Title: Perfect hotel with very warmly atmosphere!
Positive Reviews: Perfect place to stay in Kairo! Located directly at Tahrir Square it‚Äôs the perfect location for everything you want to explore in Kairo, just a few steps from the Egyptian Museum and the Nile. For going to the pyramids or other places the hotel offers a great limousine service for really fair prices. We have been in other good hotels in Kairo but this hotel is really the best and most hygienic hotel we have ever been! Perfectly cleaned rooms and bathrooms!! And also the restaurant, pool area and all other parts of the hotel we have seen were always perfectly clean. The breakfast is extraordinary delicious, fresh and offers everything you could expect from a perfect breakfast on highest standard! We loved the fresh made mango juice!! And also other food we ordered during day time or in the evening was just amazing!! The staff (restaurant, front office, room service, housekeeping) was always super friendly and courteous. Special thanks to Mr.Karim from the pool bar, Mr.Shauki from the restaurant, Mr.Mario from the front office, Mrs.Riham from Guest Relation and Mr.Mochtar (doorman). You welcomed us from the first moment in a warmly and cordially way and made us a perfect stay in your hotel!!

Review Title: Great hotel in an excellent location.
Negative Reviews: Everything exceeded our expectations.
Positive Reviews: Mr. Abdul at the reception was exceptionally helpful.  The room he gave us was quiet, as we had asked for, with very good bed, great shower, and spotlessly clean. The location of the hotel is excellent, in a short walking distance from  the Egyptian Museum.  The bar at the ground floor  is great and so is the breakfast, the a la carte restaurant and the buffet restaurant. Special thanks also to our waitresses Mariam at the a la carte restaurant, and all the other staff who without exception made our stay very pleasant.

Negative Reviews: Nothing. Everything was on point.
Positive Reviews:
The staff were amazing. Always on hand to help  . Complimentary bottled water, fruit juices and soft drinks  was great especially in the hot weather.
Yahya was our daily housekeep and did a brilliant job of making sure we always had what we needed.
Farida from customer relations made sure to check in with us daily to answer any questions and make sure all was well.
Dr Motaz who was the doctor.on call in the hotel did a brilliant job of seeing us when we were poorly and followed up with visits to make sure we were on the mend.
Room service offered some amazing food during this time.
The breakfast buffet spread was amazing. So many different options daily.
The hotel staff go above and beyond to make sure you have a comfortable stay.
We didn't have netflix or any other subscription channel available however found that the MiX channel showed some brilliant hollywood movies daily.
I would also recommend taking advantage of the spa treatments that are available.
We initially went for a room with a side nile view however due to sickness and not being able to open the windows on a high floor we moved to a poolside room with a terrace. I can say that we actually ended up preferring this option with the outside space. On the 2nd floor with the gym, spa and swimming pool area. Just be aware though that the outside traffic noise is alot more noticeable and does go on into the night.
Overall, we had a fab stay and would definitely recommend to others.

The location ,,the building is considered recent not very old,,in front of the Egyptian museum and very near to any place in Tahir square for shopping.

The staff is amazing starting from the reception,general relationship,the staff in the restaurant and the room service,housekeeping,

The food is very good,,the room size is ok  but the city view to museum friends on the price of the room .

Review Title: Good safe stay in Tahrir Square
Negative Reviews: No views for this category of rooms. The room keys worked infrequently which made us return to the reception multiple times for reactivation. The worst thing was this manager who took my phone on the last day of my stay to tell me about Booking.com genius account but had gone ahead and given the hotel a 10 star rating and a comment 'Exceptional' without my knowledge. I came to know about this when I received an email from booking.com that my review has been approved. That was unethical and a gross invasion of the privacy of a guest. Now I understand now how they have a 9 star rating for a property that should be around 8. So please ignore such ratings from other reviews.

Negative Reviews: No complains.
Positive Reviews:
Very nice hotel, clean, comfortable and excellent location. 
We had a minor issue with a floor lamp which was dealt with super quickly, but that was not enough: We were offered an upgrade as well. Not necessary, but of course appreciated. 
The new room was closer to the street however, and we had issues sleeping as traffic in Cairo is... Well, louder than what we are used to. 
I asked if it was at all possible to move us again (and would have been perfectly fine with returning to the room we previously had, upgrade or not!) - and not only was my request granted, but we actually received yet another upgrade, to a suite in a quiet area.

And as if this was not enough, we even had a very kind surprise waiting for us in the room (beautiful rose petals on the bed and in a bubble bath, it was our honeymoon).

Amazing service, absolutely above and beyond expectations. 

A big thank you to the Assistant Front Office Manager, Mr. Mahmoud Hamza, who was incredibly kind, thoughtful and accommodating. The whole staff also deserve a compliment. 

I would absolutely recommend the Steigenberger El Tahrir if you're considering a visit to central Cairo - and I will return to the brand when I visit a location where they are present.

This review is for the day I checked out. 
Hotel checkout is often the last interaction that guests have with the hotel staff and it is important to leave a lasting positive impression.

Firstly, when I called the reception for assistance, the bellboy arrived promptly, ensuring that my needs were met in a timely manner. 

Secondly, as per my request, I was allowed to keep my room card as a souvenir. This is rare and it‚Äôd be great if more hotels provided such option. Especially for people like me who loves to collect such cards. 

Lastly, I was pleasantly surprised when Mr. Mahmoud Hamza, Assistant Front Office Manager at the hotel, offered me a complementary limo ride to the airport. This gesture went above and beyond my expectations and made my departure from the hotel a truly memorable experience.

In conclusion, the service provided during my hotel checkout was exceptional and made me feel genuinely loved as a guest.
The personalized attention, genuine interest, and sincere farewell were all aspects that stood out and made me feel like my satisfaction truly mattered. This experience has left a positive and lasting impression on me, and I will definitely be returning to this hotel for my future stays.

Review Title: Best 4-star experience and value for money.
Negative Reviews: Just the wifi download speed, but, thats across all areas in Cairo. May be the telecom provider issue.
Positive Reviews:
Experience:
Ok let me be honest. This hotel should be the role model for all other 4 star hotels in the world. The experience you get here is equal to that of 5-stars. Right from the security to reception to housekeeping to dining - All are perfect. My special compliment to Farida, Marina and Mahmoud for providing exceptional guest service during my stay. My stay here was for 5 night, but, I extended to another 6 nights.

Dining and Breakfast: 
The breakfast is super. Wide selection and very attentive staff. In other hotel, when the staff barely attend your table to offer a coffee or any other service, this hotel staff simply make sure you feel like home and pampered to max. 

Location
Close to el tharir square, and just 200m from the bustling market where you name it and you find it. A heaven for someone who wants to shop, dine, walk and experience.

Transportation:
Easily available to and fro to hotel. Nile Corniche is just a 10-min waking distance. But you need some road crossing skills as the traffic might be dodgy.

Parking:
The hotel has parking space available underground. Didnt try but good for people who wish to drive and park their vehicle.

Rooms:
Rooms are small, but, clean. The houskeeping staff are really attentive and address to all your immediate needs. Good for couple who need best experience and value-for-money stay.

Bar:
I dont drink. But there are ample of space for guests to unwind and enjoy live music. Oh yes, i dont remember the singer voice, but, she is too good and her voice is no less than a celeb.

Negative Reviews: The noise outside was a bit much but that‚Äôs Cairo, I suppose
Positive Reviews: We stayed at the Steigenberger in Cairo on our way down to the South. The staff are very friendly, the hotel centrally located and feels very safe. The reception staff are keenly helpful and are constantly looking for ways to improve your experience. We were able to walk to some of the key sites we wanted to see, including the Egyptian Museum. We were looked after extremely well, and despite our extra requirements, the hotel were very accommodating, including letting us check out late when our flight was delayed. The breakfast quality was high (especially compared to other hotels we were in during our stay on Egypt), the room and facilities clean. Considering the economic difficulties in Egypt at present, this isn't easy. We can thoroughly recommend the hotel.

The hotel offers a great service, values customers and not money, amd offers a great price / quality correlation.

We arrived in very late and were delighted to be able to enjoy a full meal with a bottle of wine at 1.30am. The restaurant staff were very welcoming and helpful.  The hotel location was good altough walking across the road from the Cairo Museum was an experience never to be forgotten!   The concept of pedestrian crossings seems to be alien in Egypt......just head down and go!!

Hotel is in a great location for walking to site or catching an Uber or taxi. The staff were amazing. So friendly and helpful. Gave us some great recommendations for restaurants in the area. 
Althought the pool area is not large it was a great atmosphere to sit and relax,eat and swim. The lemon mint non-alcoholic drink wa so refreshing after a long hot day.

The staff is very accommodating and helpful. The front desk staff, the concierge, guest relations managers, and serving staff all did a great job in making our stay comfortable. Since we were returning to this property after traveling in other parts of Egypt, we were able to leave behind one bag for almost 10 days. The restaurant serves excellent food. The grilled salmon, the Steigenberger burger, and the burrata are all excellent. The shop near the reception area that sells jewelry and souvenirs, though small, offers a good selection at great prices. An ATM is located inside the reception area itself, which makes it easy to withdraw cash. In terms of location, it can't get any better. The hotel is centrally located and situated right next to the Egyptian Museum. Given that we stayed at this property twice during our travels in Egypt, we highly recommended the Steigenberger Hotel El Tahrir.
location perfect staff amazing food extra delicious

Review Title: superior customer service, perfect location, safe
Positive Reviews:
Front desk and entire staff are fabulous, especially Riham the Guest Relations Supervisor.  Restaurant is amazing. Food is excellent and customer service is excellent. 

Special recognition to Christine, Mariam, Saddek and Shahd in the restaurant. The entire team at the hotel works hard to make your stay comfortable. Transportation manager Hany is fabulous and so is ‚ÄúMo‚Äù the driver. Bell staff are equally amazing. 

Overall a great experience and the hotel is conveniently located in the center of the city. Safe and secure property.

Staff are very helpful, especially Asil/ÿßÿµŸäŸÑ at front desk who was professional & kindly facilitated extending our stay. Breakfast includes a wide variety & is of excellent quality.  Location allows for easy access to city centre & main attractions.  Would highly recommend & return to Steigenberger Hotel/El Tahrir on future visits to Cairo.

Negative Reviews: Non
Positive Reviews:

The location of the hotel was great. It was right next to Cairo Museum and Tahrir square. We could walk to the Qasr-Nile bridge and enjoy the riverside. 
The best thing about the hotel was its staff. The restaurant staff was outstanding. The breakfast buffet had a good variety of local and international cuisine. Car rental service was also good (though a bit expensive) and the drivers were no less than your guides. 

The best thing in the stay was the Guest Relations Supervisor Ms. Riham Khaled. We had a late evening flight and were worried about the checkout time which is generally before lunch. Riham was so forthcoming and helpful she arranged for us a late checkout (at 5pm - can you believe it?). 
The whole staff made us feel comfortable and welcome throughout our stay. 
We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Review Title: Across the road from Cairo Museum. Walking distance from Nile. Walking distance from downtown.
Negative Reviews: Noises + in room service Food was expesive and not good
Positive Reviews: Location + Staff + clean + 24hrs food availability

Negative Reviews: The cleaning staff sometimes was trying too much to get our attention and start a conversation with us like many men outside the hotel (we were two women travelling alone). The beverage orders at the Oxygen Bar take some time to arrive and I ordered hot milk at breakfast for the coffee that never arrived. The suitcases are stored outside the hotel in the closed parking, there is no separate luggage room - security wise okay but warm outside so this could be mentioned in case people have anything in their luggage that may be sensitive to heat. Finally, the room was overall clean - we were told they are running a project to renew the carpet floors which is indeed needed but otherwise fine. It could be useful to have another plug in the bathroom for other devices such as hair straighteners. One security guard at the hotel door accepted "tips" by a driver to speed up the checks on the ID cards and license.
Positive Reviews: The breakfast offers a very large variety of things to try. The service staff was welcoming and polite. The location is very good and the beds are comfortable. Overall very good value for money.

The food (except the breakfast) could use a little
love. We dined twice in the restaurant and we‚Äôre disappointed both times. The value for the food was not worth it and the meals that we had were a let down.
Positive Reviews: The location, the staff and the room was all fantastic in this hotel. The beds were super comfy and I especially loved how safe it felt. We stayed a total of 3 days and had a great time. The walking distance from the hotel to the museum was our main point of attraction and it did not disappoint, it was super close! We loved that the restaurants were open very late so you were able to have dinner after 10pm. The breakfast spread was one of the best we‚Äôve had in Egypt. The facility to catch Uber and go over to Zamalek or really anywhere is also great! Everything is close. This hotel chain never does me wrong :)

Review Title: Good choice but little bit overestimated
Negative Reviews: Cleaning of the room was not good: we found dust at many surfaces of the furniture and carpet, not critical but not acceptable for 4-stars hotel. Water was leaking under the glass wall of the shower cabin. Staff in the breakfast restaurant was able to manage all needs of guests only if the load was very low, when one day the restaurant was loaded up to about 70% everything failed: no coffee, no cleaning, no napkins.
Positive Reviews: The hotel is perfectly located nearby Tahrir, the central square of Cairo. Metro station Sadat is 100 m away, the Egyptian Museum is 5 min walk. A lot of local and international restaurants and cafes could be reached in a few minutes. Very fast check-in and check-out with excellent reception staff. The room is very silent and spaced enough for two people. Breakfast is good and very various, a lot of local food, special coffee options like cappuccino or espresso are available without additional fee. Swimming pool is heated (very heated!!!) and pool-bar is opened up to the sunset.

Negative Reviews:
The water, while running, kept switching from very hot to ice cold both when showering and when simply using the bathroom sink. It‚Äôs strange that I encountered the same issue at Steigenberger Nile Palace Luxor - Convention Center. 

The street noise level in the rooms - we all know Cairo is loud, the constant car honking and buzz etc., however, for a hotel in the 4 star league, and with such a reputation and price tag, to not have good soundproofing, is a fairly big no-no.  
One can barely sleep 3-4 hours per night because of this. (I live in a noisy city that never sleeps, thus I‚Äôm not super sensitive.)
Positive Reviews:
The location is perfect. The staff is very professional, accommodating and do their best to make sure you have a great stay. 

I cannot comment on the breakfast, bar, restaurant facilities because I didn‚Äôt get a chance to try them. They have a spa, I absolutely recommend getting a massage, especially if it‚Äôs before taking your flight home. 

The wifi is so and so‚Ä¶same problem all over Egypt. 

The room service is good and fairly fast. A suggestion to the room service team - please allow an hour after food has been delivered before calling for feedback. It‚Äôs a great idea and highly appreciated, just need a bit of extra time so that we can actually taste the food before giving feedback.

Negative Reviews: Not really the fault of the hotel, all dependent on your neighbors I guess, but every noise in the room adjacent could be heard. Was a problem at 4am when guests started banging and attempting to get into our room. Phoned reception and they resolved the problem immediately. Also, because of the location, you will hear either dogs or street traffic at certain points during the day/ night. With earplugs, not a problem.
Positive Reviews: Location was ideal; staff were very helpful and friendly; we either ordered room service or ate at the restaurant our entire stay and every meal we tried was phenomenal; food was great value for money; beds were comfy; sauna and pool were well maintained and relaxing; gym was small but had enough equipment in to have a solid workout; breakfast also had enough choice in the morning for a solid breakfast; WiFi was relatively smooth. Also, our first room was small and had a discomforting smell but they immediately upgraded us when I phoned down.

Review Title: Comfortable stay in the heart of Cairo.
Negative Reviews: It was clear that one of the mattress needed to be replaced. Staff could be friendlier. Although good, breakfast was a bit repetitive
Positive Reviews: It was clean. Staff were adequately friendly. Rooms were comfortable. Location was in city center. Breakfast was good.

Negative Reviews: There are room for improvement to power up your hotel standard. People said that the rooms are small which is understandable for downtown location. Our thoughts are that you can play with the use of the room, such as larger the side of bedside shelves. We like to put book, glasses, phone and glass of water next to our bed. 2-seater sofa instead of one, so 2 guests can sit together, watching TV or having snack together. The hotel might originally be for a business stay for 1 person but look around at breakfast, there are a lot of couples. Anything in the room that will be good for 2 people or business purpose (larger working table) will be good.
Positive Reviews:
Location, safety and breakfast are 3 best things of these hotel. It's in downtown Cairo, just opposite the Egyptian Museum. There's a barrier, scanner and a sniffy dog for all cars those will enter hotel parking area. Also, people and bag scanners which made us feel safe. However, walking outside at night to downtown area is also safe and hassle free. Breakfast is cheerful and generous. The breakfast manager is really nice, sorry we forgot his name. 

We were upgraded to VIP, which mean we can have free soft-drink in room minibar, welcome snacks, fruits (apples) and 3 laundry items. These help our stay more relaxing, thank you.

Review Title: Convenient Location for Tourists in Cairo
Negative Reviews: Rooms are a bit small, especially for the price. Fitness center is also small with not much equipment (for a 4-star hotel), and you have an attendant watching you the whole time. Dinner options are not the best, and there are few restaurants you can walk to.
Positive Reviews: Staff is incredibly friendly. Hotel is safe and secure. The rooms and bathrooms are clean. The bed is very comfortable. A/C works fine. Curtains are decent, although light still comes in around the edges. WiFi is okay. Decent location for Egypt, but there are very few restaurants around. Breakfast is decent.

Review Title: Central location but not worth the premium over other options
Negative Reviews: It was not special for the price and was crowded with noisy bus tours.  We paid for the upgraded Nile view room, which may have been worth it to get the higher floor (assuming lower floors were nosier), but was not worth it for the "fruit basket" (three apples) or the view (city view with some Nile, but not particularly worth looking at).  We've stayed in central downtown hotels around the world that offered a more spectacular experience and were somewhat disappointed overall.  The room was noisy because the area around the hotel is very busy, and we were able to sleep with the white noise machines on our phones. The pool is on the 2nd floor and is so loud with all the honking from the traffic that we found it unpleasant.  The food in the restaurant was tasty but the service at breakfast (service at dinner was fine) managed to be both annoyingly obsequious and inattentive at the same time. [Pro tip: if you are tired of waiting for a breakfast server to fill your coffee cup, just try to go to the coffee station and fill it yourself--you'll be chastised, but they'll bring you coffee.  Also, ask for espresso, cappuccino or latte instead of a "coffee"--their plain coffee is awful.]  Overall, we will not be returning.  We found our earlier accommodations at a smaller hotel in Giza with a spectacular breakfast and pyramid views to be more to our tastes.
Positive Reviews: Service was friendly.  If you need to be near Tahrir Square the location cannot be beat.  Central location (both a plus and a minus), mostly comfortable room (bed was slightly more firm than we would have liked), decent restaurant, lots of choices for breakfast.  The location is right next to the Egyptian Museum and lots of shopping and cultural sites.  The bathroom has a nice shower.

Review Title: well run, great place to stay in central cairo

Breakfast is massive, you will find something for you on that buffet.  The room was spacious, had a separate seating area.  Water pressure was good.

Amazing stay. The hotel is located at the heart of Cairo and it is near to all facilities and main attractions. 
The rooms are super clean and the staff is so friendly and caring.
You almost feel like home. 
Definitely, I will return to the same hotel every time I will visit Egypt

Review Title: Comfortable short stay in a modern, friendly hotel
Negative Reviews: Pool wasn't in the sun much if at all. No other negatives to speak about.
Positive Reviews:
Only stayed 1 night before our flight back - but wished we booked this place for a few nights when we arrived!
Great location - just off the main square and only a 5-10 min walk to downtown.
Lovely modern decor, feel and facilities. Staff were incredibly friendly and helpful (without angling for tips). As we checked in late (about 1:45am) we were bumped up to a suite and given a 1:30pm checkout which was an unexpected bonus.
Shower hot and powerful. Bed was incredibly comfortable. Room was clean and spacious.
WIFI was strong in all areas
Pool area quiet and serene - depsite only being a few feet away from a main road.
If you want a modern, clean and comfortable stay in Cairo - you surely can't do much better than this.

Negative Reviews:
Nothing Nothing Nothing

Positive Reviews:
Everything was greatttt, from lobby, to elevators, all the way to the room... everything was amazing
Staff is very polite and helpful and they keep asking if they met our expectations. my reply was: you are over my expectation. Location is also very good, and their Limousine service reliable and affordable.
Will ONLY stay there when in Cairo

The Room provided was just perfect. Spacious with a good view. It was good to find a fully stocked snack bar after so long (This is the first hotel, post the Covid chaos, that had a snack bar).

Loved the environment-friendly gestures like non-plastic tableware, fixed & big sized toiletries instead of miniature bottles and auto on/off corridor lights. 

It was good to find complementary fruits and fresh chocolates when I came back to my room in the evening.

The hotel was a breath of fresh air during our wonderful trip to Cairo. The facilities are great and the staff are really accommodating. The air conditioning is lovely too! Fantastic location for a quick trip to the most incredible museum across the road!! Basma at reception was especially helpful throughout our entire stay and she helped us in amending our check out time to suit our schedule which we really appreciated. Highly recommend!

Very good location, great service, spacious rooms with very comfortable beds and large shower.

Review Title: The Steigenberger Tahrir Cairo hotel is a perfect 4-star hotel in Egypt, with top-notch hospitality, spacious and clean
Positive Reviews:
My partner and I recently stayed at the Steigenberger Tahrir Cairo hotel, and I have to say it was perfect. Even in Egypt, where stars are not always a match, this hotel truly lived up to its 4-star rating. The hospitality was top-notch and the hotel was very clean, reminding me of European standards.

The rooms were spacious and well-appointed, with all the amenities you could need for a comfortable stay. The bed was very comfortable and we both slept very well during our stay. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, always willing to go the extra mile to make sure we had everything we needed.

The hotel's location was also excellent, with many of Cairo's main attractions within easy reach. We enjoyed exploring the city during the day and returning to the hotel in the evenings for some rest and relaxation.

Overall, I cannot recommend the Steigenberger Tahrir Cairo hotel enough. It is a very clean and top-notch hotel with excellent hospitality that truly exceeded our expectations. If you are looking for a comfortable and enjoyable stay in Cairo, this is definitely the place to

A great hotel receptionist possesses excellent communication skills, a friendly and welcoming demeanor, and the ability to multitask effectively. They are knowledgeable about the hotel's services, amenities, and local attractions, allowing them to provide guests with recommendations and assistance in making the most of their stay.

Receptionists like Mustafa can create a positive and memorable experience for guests by being attentive, responsive, and proactive. They handle check-ins and check-outs efficiently, ensuring a smooth process. They also handle reservations, answer phone calls, and address any issues that may arise during a guest's stay.

Furthermore, a good receptionist like Mustafa understands the importance of empathy and patience, especially when dealing with guest complaints or concerns. They strive to resolve any issues promptly and professionally, going above and beyond to ensure guest satisfaction.

In summary, a hotel receptionist like Mustafa contributes significantly to the overall guest experience by providing excellent customer service, knowledge, and assistance. They are the superheroes behind the front desk, making guests feel welcome and ensuring their stay is enjoyable.

Review Title: A Beautiful Welcoming and Warm Experience in Cairo because of the staff at Steigenberger Hotel
Positive Reviews: I have only positive things to say about our time staying at Steigenberger Hotel, after a terrible stay at a nearby hotel this hotel was a refuge, a place of warmth and comfort. the staff were incredible, all the staff we encountered were amaaaaaaazing but I especially remember Mario, Mageid and Reham on the front text, Nada from the cleaning staff, Muktar and Abdullah on the door as well as Abdullah in Security and Ahmed in the restaurant. The restaurant served delicious food, the room service was good they always called to check all was well with the food, once there was something I didn't like the taste of and they replaced the food immediately and even gave us some fruits and drinks for free, there was wonderful hospitality from Shawqi. It was a bit cold in Cairo when we were there, they gave us heaters immediately. The laundry service was amazing too. I felt at home, welcomed whenever we stepped through the doors as though we were family. InshaAllah anytime I visit Cairo there is no other place I plan to stay.

The wifi login didn't work, every day I had to ask a receptionist to enter the code for me, because my combination room+name was not working. This for the entire period I was there (4 days), despite knowing the root cause, it was never fixed. It was annoying. 
You cannot sent postcards from the hotel, even if with the stamps. As it is not easy to find a post box in Cairo (not even the guides know where they are), it would be a nice service, as the hotel has to send mail anyway.

Review Title: hotel is good (especially value for money) but suffers from being in Cairo
Negative Reviews:
Cairo is noisy, dirty and really, really oppressive (this from a Londoner) so the hotel suffered from being in Cairo! for example:
-lounging by the pool is noisy; the car horns are ridiculous and consequently the background music is turned right up. really horrible.
-it‚Äôs also dirty - it‚Äôs pollution in the air (cars, dust and sand) and nothing to do with the hotel except its location. however, it IS really bad. if you are asthmatic, make sure you have spare inhalers!
-We went to the Pool Bar one afternoon (3pm?) and they were out of beer and none appeared for the rest of the day. The next day, they managed to locate some. BUT we had to go and request it and wait. We are not hopeless lushes! we had been touring the sites all day and just wanted to chill with a beer before dinner.
-no clocks, even on the room tv. really weird that there are no (zero!) clocks anywhere so you have to have your own
-restaurent food isn‚Äôt very Egyptian. honestly, why go to Egypt and eat European?
- the traffic in the near area is BONKERS. Crossing the road is seriously scary. makes getting around really hard or you take cabs everywhere (though they are really cheap).

Really nice: the cordial welcome and truly attentive and enthousiastic staff, in particular, a 'unique' receptionist. This is an enormous plus for the hotel. 
In addition, the location next to the Tahrir Square, the Egyptian Museum and the Arab League Headquarters, as well as the proximity to the Nile, are great advantages. 
The breakfast was unforgettable. Quite possibly the best in the world.

Negative Reviews:
I didn‚Äôt get my city view 
Fruits for guest looks old not fresh
Positive Reviews: I booked a room with a city view on higher floor, the front receptionist said I‚Äôll give you a nice room, so we end up in a room with a side view of the swimming pool and a wall which we didn‚Äôt care for, we were just too tired from exploring Cairo to go back down to complain so we end up staying in the room

Negative Reviews: Would have liked a rooftop / view of the city,  but that's about it
Positive Reviews: Great hotel. Super friendly staff, and service. Spacious rooms that were always clean!Centrally located.

Review Title: I will visit this property again, hopefully my reviews are taken into consideration
Negative Reviews:
Needs more attention to cleanliness in the room as there were spots in the room that were untouched.
Room carpet either had intentional pattern showing spots or they were actually spots remains a mystery.
Everytime I stepped out and returned to the room I had to re-register to gain the WIFI access.
At Check-in or through room service, please remember to ask them to install toilet handjet/washer if you are not friendly to toilet paper.
Amount collected at check-in as deposit, would be returned to your card after 14days, am not sure why.
Positive Reviews:
Value of money
Swift Check-in
Excellent location, centrally located.
Fantastic breakfast spread, everything is fresh and caters to all age requirements.
All staff members are helpful and look forward to serve you better.

Review Title: perfect to discover vibrant Cairo & come home to a chique, relaxing hotel with heated pool & sauna.
Negative Reviews: We went in january, during a cold week. There are no heaters integrated in the rooms aircosystem which can lead to chilly rooms and restaurant. But they when I called to ask about it, they immedeatly brought us an electric heater to the room. Perfect service!
Positive Reviews:
The people at the reception were very helpful with all of our questions. I they even let me use their phone to call my airline since they had changed my flights. And i was on hold for very long! Thanks to mahmoud, if i remember your name correctly. The rerstaurant is open until very late. I could not believe it. Good, fancy food. 
The pool is accessible and heated, so lovely. The fitnesscenter is accessible 24/7. there is an ATM machine in the lobby which has the option to change currencys. It is super close by the Museum of Egypt Civilisations and at walking distance of all kind of shops if you are looking to buy clothes, shoes, etc.. We especially want to thank Mokhtar for his advices and Egyptian friendliness. We very much enjoyed our stay!

Review Title: Super clean & cosy rooms. Centrally located
Negative Reviews: The AC is at a constant temperature making the room chilly, However, the staff are prompt to provide a portable heater which keeps the room nice and warm!
Positive Reviews: Beautiful and super neat & clean hotel! The breakfast spread is great. Lot of delicious continental and Egyptian options. The staff are very polite and helpful. We got a complimentary early check-in as well. The hotel is located in a good area. It is walking distance to Tahrir Square which has restaurants, convenience stores & shops.

Review Title: Great choice to stay few days in Cairo.
Negative Reviews: Breakfast was varied however some dishes were very salty. The access card to the room is very poor, we have to re-register many times, causing unnecessary time loss.
Positive Reviews: The room service is excellent. Big thanks to Mr. Mohamed, who provide room services for us in rooms 7035 and 7034 during our stay at the hotel.

Negative Reviews:
They don't have triple rooms as far as I'm aware of, so our stay ended up being a bit more expensive (we were three adults). 
Unfortunately I wasn't able to have breakfast (I had paid separately for it when checking in) because I wasn't feeling well, but that's not the hotel's fault of course.
Positive Reviews: After a week running around Egypt (and after having slept in a not-so-nice hotel and in a quite old cruise boat) staying at this hotel felt really nice. It is right in front of the egyptian museum, so the position is perfect if you want to see it. My room was quite big and everything was clean, the bed was really comfy and the bathroom is nice with a great shower. The staff was very polite and efficient. You can also have dinner there if you don't want to venture out in Cairo after a long day, and the food was okay (they have quite a bit of international dishes as can be expected in these hotels).

Review Title: Large hotel with comfortable facilities and good location,
Negative Reviews: Some reception staff are very indifferent and almost rude. An example is Mr. Marawan who will not interact or explain to you relevant aspects such as taxi to the airport or check out process, etc.
Positive Reviews: Large facilities with a great pool bar, fitting center and restaurant. The location is steps form the Tahrir Square and Egyptian Museum is across the road. Reception staff is helpful specially Farida.

Review Title: Excellent location and staff. Value for money is not great, avoid the restaurant.
Negative Reviews: Value for money. I am not familiar with the costs at Cairo, as this is my first visit. However, comparing the cost with hotels of similar or better category in the Middle East, London and other European capitals, I expected more space, better facilities and a far better restaurant. The restaurant was crowded, noisy (terrible acoustic design, zero sound absorption) made worse during the evening by singers belting out with a noisy sound system in the adjacent hall. Food was not good, far from you would expect for a hotel of this cost.
Positive Reviews:
Excellent location, excellent staff. Reception staff are extremely helpful, friendly and knowledgeable.
My special thanks to Mai, the cleaner and Haidy at the bar, for their sterling work and making us feel welcome.

Negative Reviews:
Room Air Conditioning got turned off while we go out and upon return, it gives fouling smell due to lack of air circulation, assess and rectify.
Wifi coverage inside room was not adequate.
Shoe polish with brush would be great in all rooms otherwise in a common place at every floor....
Positive Reviews:
Excellent breakfast, modern toiletries, adequate lighting, comfort room size, nice dining hall, well designed space usage. 
Excellent front office service, coordial reception, polite dining services...well deserved to accredit to 5*

Review Title: Overall the hotel was a 10/10. The staff was very welcoming and addressed all concerns.
Negative Reviews: The only complaint was the size of the pool (however, I saw the pictures online so I was expecting it.)  I suggest going to the pool before 4:30pm if you want to actually enjoy swimming around. It gets very crowded later in the day.
Positive Reviews:
I took my children and 2 of their friends for my son's 30th Birthday. I informed the hotel of his birthday before arrival and they placed a complimentary cake in his room on his actual birthday. I wanted a hotel in a walkable area and this hotel did not disappoint. We were literally across the street from the Egyptian Museum so no need to book with a tour company. We felt safe in the area as we were out walking around with the locals every night until 2-3am. They have security outside to ensure that only guests of the hotel or arranged transportation enters the property. 

The food at the hotel was very good and affordable and they had many options to choose from. I ordered room service at least once a day because of my busy days/late nights I didn't have the energy to go down to the restaurant; they always called to make sure our food was satisfactory and if not they would correct/remake it.  There is a mini fridge provided in each room and they stock it each day as needed. Only a very small amount of the items are complimentary the rest you pay for with a charge to your room at check-out.  

The staff was very welcoming when we arrived for check-in at 2:30am. I reserved 3 different rooms and they were able to accommodate my requests of having the rooms close to one another. I had 2 rooms connecting and 1 was only 3 doors down from the rest.

The pool area has a TV that they had turned to the soccer games and they have hookahs at the pool and also a bar. There is free ice water at the pool to help keep you hydrated while sitting out in the heat.

Review Title: Great option in central Cairo with good cost x benefit relation.
Negative Reviews: In fact the room is not completely sound proof and, being in Cairo, it means you will listen to the omnipresent noise of the car horns. But it's not a huge problem, you can sleep well!
Positive Reviews: Everything was quite nice! The room is spacious and confortable, with a big and confy bed. Breakfast is amazing, whit a lot of different kinds of fruits, breads, eggs etc. Staff was very helpful and kind, they also helped me receiving a food delivery!

Review Title: The perfect home base for a short sightseeing trip! Skip the massage tho.
Negative Reviews:
The noise at the outdoor pool from the traffic and car horns blaring. 
Gym is small. 
I got a massage in the ‚Äúspa.‚Äù Really just a counter in the already small gym. The massage room is a tiny room off the locker room, so during my massage all I heard was the banging of locker doors and bathroom doors. My therapist didn‚Äôt speak much English at all, so it was hard to convey what I wanted or didn‚Äôt want. This spa experience was the low point of my stay, which was otherwise fantastic.
Positive Reviews: Clean, bright lobby, clean hallways. Nicely appointed rooms with comfy beds and modern bathrooms. Quiet inside the room and hotel. Nice outdoor pool with an outdoor bar. Great restaurant and bar in the lobby. Breakfast is incredible, every food you can imagine and staff waiting on you like you‚Äôre royalty. I was only here 2 days but I had breakfast before setting out on long hot sightseeing days, and I had dinner poolside both evenings.

Review Title: Exceptional service, high cleanliness, would definitely do it again!

Positive Reviews: The friendliness of the staff was exceptional, cleanliness was also very high and remarkable. The room service was 24 hours and the food was delicious

There is a plethora of options for everyone.

Review Title: Very comfortable and convenient, with excellent, helpful staff; not perfect, but nowhere is.
Negative Reviews:
The only complaints I have are about the actual design of the room, which the staff and ownership really have no say over. One, there are NO fans in the bathrooms, which means a hot shower fogs up the space and the mirror and simply floods out into the rest of the room once the door is open. Two, nearly all the lights in the room are on one switch and cannot be turned off separately; this includes the lights for the concessions space, which were really bright and faced directly into the beds area.

These are all fairly minor complaints that are basically infrastructure issues with whomever designed the hotel. So, they were annoying but manageable.
Positive Reviews: Room was clean, quiet, comfortable. Plenty of storage space even for two people. We had basically twin beds but they were comfortable and didn't feel too small. Hotel is very well-placed in the city and access to taxis, Uber, and local restaurants and shops was easy. Staff were GREAT, very friendly and helpful, and the restaurant had a huge array of food and drink options.

Review Title: Excellent location and great service, but our stay was negatively impacted by various issues, especially secondhand smok
Negative Reviews: Our major issue was that despite having a room on a non-smoking floor and smoking being banned on elevators, the hallway, elevators, and bar area reeked of tobacco smoke and made us feel sick. A few other minor issues - the hairdryer could not be used above level 1 due to limited power, the hotel provides a 2-in-1 shampoo and conditioner instead of separate shampoo and conditioner, and our room felt overly musty/humid due to poor ventilation in the bedroom and no ventilation in the bathroom. Additionally, frequent use of the gym restroom by male staff made gym use slightly uncomfortable for female guest.
Positive Reviews: Wonderful, helpful staff and service. They provided a complimentary extension of our check-out time, which we really appreciated. Breakfast and room service were exceptional. Gym facilities were nice and well-serviced.

Negative Reviews: Party noises at night. Nile view room paid option have small windows.
Positive Reviews: Friendly staff, cleanliness of rooms and wide variety of choices in breakfast buffet.

Review Title: Very comfortable hotel in a good location.
Negative Reviews: View is not very interesting, even though we were upgraded to a pool view room.
Positive Reviews: Nice hotel next to the museum, near to the nile. Clean, comfortable, and morden hotel. Nice lobby bar for evening drinks. The breakfast was very good. Staffs are very helpful. Thank you for the late checkout.

Negative Reviews:
Our stay at the Steigenberger Hotel in Cairo was largely enjoyable, offering a serene and comfortable retreat in the bustling city. The rooms and service were impressive, and the overall atmosphere was very welcoming.

We did notice a couple of areas for improvement. There was a moment of confusion when our tour was due to pick us up, where the interaction with the security staff seemed a bit unclear. Also, on our departure day, despite having settled our bill, a staff member at the door briefly inquired about payment. While these were minor misunderstandings, they highlight an opportunity for enhanced communication and procedural clarity within the hotel team.

These small points aside, we found the Steigenberger to be a great choice in Cairo for its quality service and tranquil ambiance. We would still recommend it for a comfortable and pleasant stay.
Positive Reviews: Our stay at the Steigenberger Hotel in Cairo was a delightful experience, offering a serene oasis amidst the bustling city. The hotel provided excellent service, comfortable accommodations, and a sense of tranquility that was much appreciated. Its location is ideal for exploring Cairo, yet it offers a peaceful retreat from the city's noise and pace. We strongly advise those considering a trip to Cairo to consider investing a bit more in their accommodation, as it can make a significant difference in comfort and overall experience. Based on our encounters with other hotels in the area, the Steigenberger Hotel stands out for maintaining high standards and ensuring a pleasant stay. For anyone seeking a higher level of comfort and service, this hotel is definitely worth the extra cost.

Review Title: Had expected a lot more, therefore very disappointed
Negative Reviews:
1) We were in room 8020 and the bed was poor. The mattress was clearly old and the bed cracked whenever you moved. 
2) Even though the window glass was relatively thick, it didn't block the sound of the streets and you could hear people honking the horns of the car (one of the national sports in Egypt) all day long. And it was quite loud ... 
3) We were very tired - stayed 1 night only - and decided to have dinner at the restaurant. Bad choice. It took them about an hour to prepare dinner and the meal was overcooked and far from tasty. And this for Western European pricing ... so avoid the √† la carte restaurant if you can. Go out. There's plenty to do / eat locally.

Review Title: A great and comfortable place to stay in Cairo - with a breakfast buffet like from a dream
Negative Reviews: Though the windows should have been sound-proof, the sound made it somehow through between the window and the wall (or window frame). At times so much noise went inside that it seemed like the window is open - although we were in one of the higher levels of the building. There have been many reports like this about almost all hotels in Cairo. So it seems to be a major issue. Ear plugs are a must.
Positive Reviews: From the moment of entering the hotel you felt an international and warm flair. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean and had the Western European standards that I am used to - opposites to two other hotels where I stayed on my trip. The mini bar is filled rich with drinks and snacks, bravo. When leaving I was told the soft drinks even were for free. The prices for the other food of the minibar were reasonable. The hotel has a 24 hours restaurant. The service in the evening was a little slow, but the food was great. The breakfast ... was ... a dream! I have never seen such a breakfast in a normal city-hotel. They had simply everything! Everything! Oh, and in the evening they had a singer in the lobby, that was a surprise. If you get to Cairo, I can fully recommend the Steigenberger El Tahrir.

Negative Reviews:
Room
Even though our reservation was for a Queen bed room, we were offered a 2 single beds which was disappointing. Room was too small for what we paid for, and too noisy (seemed that the windows were not sound proof). Room decor could use an uplift.

Dinner
We had dinner at the restaurant twice, and 2 completely different experiences. The a la carte dinner was good and fair, with reasonable Egyptian food (very short wine list though). The buffet experience was astonishingly terrible, food had very low quality and we had people in our group that were sick after it.

Value for Money
Definitely the worse topic. It is a very expensive hotel for what it has to offer compared to close competitors such as Sofitel and Intercontinental. For the very high price you pay (mainly due to location, which is arguably bad given it‚Äôs impossible to walk to any destination in Cairo), quality x price is very bad. 

Drinks
For international tourists it‚Äôs important to know that the hotel charges an absurdly high amount for a simple cocktail - a gin and tonic costs nearly ¬£20 pounds!!!
Positive Reviews:
Room
Overall the Superior Queen room was regular. Bathroom was good and clean (great shower), comfortable bed and high  quality linen sheets. The fact it had an iron plank helped a lot.

Breakfast
Lots of variety and good quality food. 

Staff
Very helpful and friendly staff, offering help at anytime

Review Title: Exactly as advertised- clean, good location, excellent welcoming reception !
Negative Reviews: The bar menu shows prices exclusive of tax and mandatory 12% service charge. This is noted in the fine print at the bottom of the menu so we did not realise until we got our bill. I have no issue with service charges but I feel they should depend on the service experience. We went to the bar on two separate occasions and did not find the service good. The bar was quiet and the staff remained behind the counter, we had to go to the bar to order and again if we required a second drink. The bar staff did not appear as friendly or helpful as the reception and concierge staff, I would have gladly paid a service charge for those staff as they went above and beyond instead of a mandatory charge for poor service.

The staff at the front desk, as well as throughout the hotel, are always very eager and helpful. However, if you stay several nights, as I did, and use the minibar, laundry, bar, breakfast and dinner, for example, you get a bill that is difficult to understand. 

I would like the bills to be clearer and simpler.

Cairo traffic is all about unnecessary car horns and it goes on until the morning. Hotel does not honor silent room requests on Booking so don't bother doing so.

Positive Reviews: Great location, close to the museum, shopping district, riverfront and some of the other major hotels and their restaurants. Wide selection of foods for breakfast. Rooms clean and functional.

Review Title: the overall experince is fine. the location is good. staff are nice. but a lot of fake reviews
Negative Reviews:
DONT BE FOOLED BY THE HIGH REVIEWS OF THIS HOTEL
The hotel staff intentionally make you fill the booking survey infront of them and from their mobile device to ensure you give them a very high rating, but honestly it deserves a 6 or 7 out of 10 at most. as seeing the 9 rating gives you a lot of expectations which cant be met.
Although the hotel is good, but all textile including room carpets, bed covers, towels, etc are very old and worent out.

Negative Reviews:
BAD:
1. Rooms are old and outdated.
2. We booked a room for a family with a child, asked a non-smoking, and got a smoking room on a smoking floor. There was a bed smell in the room, and holes in the carpet from cigarettes.
3. For two adults and a child we had two sets of towels, one pair of slippers, and one bath robe.
4. Dinner buffet is awful, variety of meals is very limited, half of meals have no signs and descriptions, all the drinks, even water, are for additional price.
5. Hotel lobby also looks rather old and very outdated.
Positive Reviews:
GOOD:
1. Free wifi in rooms with average speed.
2. Good breakfast from 6 to 10:30 with salads, cheese, sausages, live omelets, eggs, porridge, fruits, variety of cold drinks, tea, and coffee.
3. Good location just near the Egyptian museum.
4. Free bottles of water, tea, and coffee in the room.
5. Minibar with drinks and snacks in the room.

Negative Reviews:

Negative Reviews:
The changing temperature of the water in the shower is unpleasant.
Curtains are not clean, the carpet is brushed instead of cleaned.
Fridge is not powerful.
The elevator which requires the use of the key is annoying, and I am not the only one who was annoyed about this, in fact every time I used it someone if not all those inside were somewhat annoyed by this. There is a box of tissues inside the elevator with a dust bin under it. 
I did not use the pool.
Positive Reviews:
This is a box hotel, no possibilities to eat outside. Nice entrance as is usually the case in those hotels, there is a small souvenir shop. The staff is very helpful.  However i had to keep reminding them that having allergies to scented products I did not want scented products in my room.  They were nice about it, but I had to remind them on 3 occasions, I was staying with them 4 days. They apologized and send me some complementary apples. I had little pastries and apples on the first day. 
There is a bench for the suitcase, which is handy. A large armoire. Good size bathroom, not a lot of space for toiletry. Nice size shower, however the hot water changes temperature throughout your shower, not pleasant. 
The bed is very comfortable. Plugs on the bedside tables, reading lamps on both sides. A comfortable chair to sit on with a table next to it. The curtains are very dusty and could use a wash everywhere inside the hotel.  The window does not open, I do not like that. There is no real garden. Water is provided, lots of it. The rooms are carpeted, and they do not seem to use a vacuum cleaner very often, I saw them using a stiff broom on two occasions to fluff the carpet‚Ä¶

Negative Reviews: They only had 6 lounge chairs by the pool, for a big hotel this was a little disappointing.
Positive Reviews: Hotel is clean and very safe. My husband and I came on our honeymoon and the hotel surprised us with a nice honeymoon cake and fruit. All of the hotel staff were very nice. When we arrived our room wasn‚Äôt ready yet (it was 9:30am) but the attendant offered us coffee and had housekeeping NJG clean it right away so we only waited 20 mins.

Negative Reviews: Nile view looks like a joke - it's  more view on a garden near Cairo museum, which is also beautiful, by the way. Negative Reviews:
First time in Cairo and the location of this hotel is great but... From check in, the staff looked grumpy. We had 4 nights in the hotel and F&B department was soooo poor.
The staff at breakfast service were dull and with little or no knowledge of the magic words.
Al carte menu is not as it reads. Ordered the Cairo meatballs(they were delicious), they were to be served with mushroom risotto but to be honest, I think we got rice pudding with no mushrooms. 
At the bar, Metwally was the only stuff who understood customer service and was very good at making cocktails. I ordered  mai Thai when Metwally wasn't at shift but got 3 different versions which were nothing close to what a mai Thai should be.
Farah, housekeeping, was amazing. You could see her smile even with her mask on. Her housekeeping skills are excellent. 
Lastly, would advise you to check and confirm your bill before you check out. We signed for a couple of bills and paid upon check out but unfortunately, a couple of days later, the hotel called us to say that they had not charged for some meals as they had been billed to another customer. 
This clearly showed that the staff did not pay attention at all as they provided the service. 
Wouldn't recommend rush to come back to this hotel nor recommend it to anyone.

Negative Reviews: we paid for pool room but the hotel does not have sufficient soundproofing as advertised (the reason we chose this hotel). In Egypt they don‚Äôt respect that people maybe sleeping, and so beep their car horns until they get their way at all hours of the day and night which is not great for all those who are trying to sleep and so looking for a hotel that advertises soundproofing is a must. we had to downgrade our room to be able to go to a higher floor where we were offered no refund or compensation, until afterwards when I got an email for 15% off my next stay and even then on the second to top floor it made very little difference to the noise. we struggled to sleep for 4 nights and had to play white noise on our phones to try and help. it was a good hotel but we only wanted a quiet place to rest our heads while we spend 15 hours a day sightseeing Cairo, Giza and even to Alexandria and this hotel failed to deliver a quiet nights rest.

Review Title: Luggage left outside on the street
Negative Reviews: Water pressure in bathroom is weak and water switches from super cold to Boiling hot. Walls not sound proof. When checking out, we asked if we can leave the luggage and when we arrived in the evening to pick them up we were told that we were supposed to get a ticket for the luggage. But when we checked out we asked specifically if that's it, and the guy at the reception confirmed that we should just leave the luggage here with him. Nonetheless our luggage was left outside the hotel on the street. This is unacceptable and we were just lucky nobody stole them. We didn't even receive an apology but where even blamed for not having those tickets.... Also 240usd for 2 nights is way overpriced for this holiday. It is outdated and look like it was a 4-5 stars maybe in the 80s...we were also quoted 400egp for airport transfer. A rip-off compared to Uber for 130egp. We just took Uber instead. Such a shame for 240usd. Be careful guys, staff is unfriendly and hotel is not worth the money

Review Title: DOUBLE CHECK YOUR CREDIT CARD PAYMENT UPON CHECK IN!!
Negative Reviews: The front desk charged me an extra $188 in taxes (2 night stay for 2 rooms) from what was agreed upon in the confirmation booking In which THE FINAL TOTAL amount included all taxes.  I politely messaged the hotel as it showed up on my credit card that they double charged me in taxes and there is a discrepancy from the final booking to the cc charges,  but they denied that it is included when the confirmation letter has it all broken down by line how much I have to pay for each tax and they will not refund the error ):   Overall, It is a very confusing check in as it is in Egyptian pounds and they did a separate cc charge per night, so I assumed at the time that the additional amount charged was a deposit.   They never gave me a proper breakdown/invoice of charges upon check in ,  they just asked for my cc and I signed the cc receipt so the lack of transparency is even more reason why they probably do this often to other customers.
