Review Title: The hotel didn't meet my expectations
Negative Reviews: The room was noisy because of the heavy traffic and the incessant beeping of car horns.  The double glazed windows didn't keep the noise at bay.  The swimming pool  was very small and inadequate.  It may have just been my room but the  bed sheets and quilt were old and soiled.  The staff changed the them quickly with new ones but I am not sure if they had been washed either but was too tired to ask.  The hotel bar menu had poor quality local wines and some expensive European wines.  We were disappointed because we had arrived from Saudi Arabia and were looking forward to enjoying some wine.  Also the spirits were very expensive.
Positive Reviews: The property is located central to the life of the town and conveniently close to the museum.  It was nice to be walking the streets with the locals. We asked for late checkout and were happy to pay the extra fee.  The hotel food was fresh and well cooked.

Review Title: OK for cleanliness but other aspects are average
Negative Reviews: I found it unacceptable that on the first day during breakfast, they didn't leave a bottle of water on the table as we asked. This is the only hotel from the three we stayed in Egypt where access to drinking water was not publicly available. The staff of the restaurant was serving water but they were not flexible to leave one bottle (an opened one) on the table. The restaurant menu is very limited. We had dinner there one night and the food (main) came with a big delay it was cold and the taste was below average. My mixed grill looked like it was cooked hours before and it was just kept under "warm lamps". The bar area is extremely small. The egg station during breakfast has a big problem. It was difficult to get eggs (omelet or fried eggs) without eggshells on them. The egg station is also dirty.

Two things must be noted: the first is regarding the open spaces, which are very very limited to a small pool (where pidgeons are used to drink all the time). This will be a downside in comparison to other hotels that have gardens and more than one restaurant, as this reveals to be key in a city like Cairo. An open air restaurant, with the quality of food of this hotel, would for sure be a great add.
The second is about the insistence of the staff to leave a feedback. While in the room, I got called continuously to ask if everything was ok (not that bad of course). Less graceful was a, let‚Äôs say, ‚Äúnudge‚Äù to leave a 5 star review on Google, in front of the staff employee while sitting in the swimming pool. I find this a very impolite attitude for a hotel of this level, which brought me, here, to lower my vote from 9 to 8.

The bedrooms are small. Aircons do not get cold enough for the sweltering cairo heat in Summer. Double beds are "Smaller" and average comfort. We requested an early check in prior to arriving as our flight landed at 6am however were declined this when we arrived at the hotel. Our room telephone did not work however was replaced.
Positive Reviews: The location is perfect, just close the the museum and Zamalek. If you get a good enough price it would be okay for a few days in Cairo (one must consider than on a three day trip to Cairo you wont spend alot of time at the hotel). One factor thats better than the more expensive 5 star hotels in the area is its easier to get an uber, taxi or shuttle to fetch you from the private parking area instead of on the street or small entranceway.

Review Title: Worst Front Office staff you can ever meet ...
Negative Reviews: I would avoid this hotel at all costs, due to very poor service. In Addition, the room fridge didn't work which is a big discomfort in the summer heat of Cairo, and when I called housekeeping, they came and replaced it with another one that also doesn't work, so no cold drinks for me during my stay at this hotel in Cairo.

Negative Reviews: The hotel does provide great hospitality. But we are humans, and mistakes do happen. Had a small misunderstanding/issue with my review for the stay. What amazed me is how gracefully Ms. Riham Khaled took responsibility of what happened, she apologised and fixed the issue. That is something what team players do. This situation should make the hotel realise what a gem of an employee Ms. Riham is. A team player like her deserve to be team lead/manager for setting an example to her subordinates. The hotel did take responsibility as well, not through words, but by their actions. Even though the issue was small, they offered to upgrade me to the best suite available and add complimentary breakfast for the rest of my stay, which I had to decline, thank you Mr. Ahmed El Sawy for understanding. Please note, I booked the cheapest room. The service, respect and warmth I got was so phenomenal that I did not feel like upgrading. So you can imagine how great of a service you‚Äôll get, if you choose to stay at Steigenberger.

Review Title: The worst stay ever in Egypt.
Negative Reviews:
There is not enough space to describe this horrible place:

- The staff was not friendly at all, sometimes aggressive. 
   We booked a taxi to visit the pyramids, paid 10 times the amount of an Egyptian taxi, and we had to discuss during 1h30 min with the driver to finally arrive at the pyramids entrance. Before that, we were forced to visit the papyrus museum where we refused to buy anything and be forced to entry in a carriage renting center, that we also refused. It is to note that the horses at the carriage renting center were nearly all exhausted and hurt (we also saw some people hit the horses that refused to move). This should never happen and even more not with a five star hotel.  This is nothing more than stealing and kidnapped guest. Finally, the driver gave us some water but it was not mineral water but Egyptian distribution water, place in a bottle that has already been opened before, what a sabotage.

   We finally decide to leave the hotel in advance, booked a taxi and informed the staff that we quit earlier. They have phone us aggressively three times in one hour to be sure that we gonna make the check out..., ok but for room that we have paid in advance.

- Impossible to exchange euro in the hotel (in the device).

- Small room with nearly no soundproofing. The staff give us a communicating room while this not what we have book.
   The half of the towels where lacking in the room.

- The staff knock enter in the room while we were naked, not one time, not two time but three time in one hour !!!

Negative Reviews:
Subject: Taxicab Robbery

Dear Steigenberger Management and to whom it may concern: 

I recently stayed at both your Pyramids and Tahir locations. While both were extremely comfortable and aesthetically pleasing, the Tahir location demonstrated a higher level of ethical responsibility.

During my stay at the Pyramids location, I needed a taxi to the Cairo airport. Following the advice of your staff, I used the taxi service located in the hotel lobby. They assured me of a reasonable price and legitimacy. However, en route to the airport, the driver pulled off to the side of the road and demanded an additional $40, claiming it was a new policy due to the new president. Feeling unsafe and anxious about missing my flight, I felt compelled to pay.

Later, I confirmed that this policy was a fabrication. Adding to my frustration, the driver had the audacity to ask for a tip after dropping me off far from the terminal entrance. On subsequent trips to the airport with different taxi services, I was dropped off directly in front of the terminal for a lower fare, which confirmed my suspicion of being deceived.

The $40 (1872 Egyptian pounds) may not be a large sum, but the manner in which it was extorted leaves me feeling extremely dissatisfied and with a bitter sense of mistrust. I had no such issues with taxis I booked through other means or at the Tahir location, indicating a significant problem with the personnel at the Pyramids location.

While I appreciate the upgraded room and the view of the pyramids from the pool area provided at the Pyramids location, it does not compensate for the distressing experience of being exploited in such a manner.

Sincerely,
Robbed at Steigenberger

Negative Reviews: Incredibly bad hotel.  I was denied access to the restaurant twice because a group of men of Arabic origin announced themselves and, as a white European, I therefore have no right to a seat.  I was also refused a conversation with the manager on the grounds that I should order something through room service.  This order was then served cold after waiting over an hour.

The bathroom door knob in our room developed a problem and could not be opened.Water overflowed in the shower room, flooding the bathroom and even the toilet.
Pillowcases and bedspreads were dirty, ticks bit my arm and gave me eczema, and amenities were only provided for one person even though there were two of us staying. We were told at check-in that all drinks in the room fridge were free, but were charged at check-out and almost had a fight with the staff. We also stayed at another hotel of this group in Luxor, the Steigenberger Nile Palace Luxor, which was as bad or worse than this hotel in Cairo. This unpleasant hotel made me hate Egypt and I will never go back.
